title: Trump inauguration live stream - How to watch Donald Trump's inauguration online

organizations.name: archbishop of new york timothy michael cardinal dolan

text:
Trump inauguration live stream - How to watch Donald Trump's inauguration online Trump inauguration live stream - How to watch Donald Trump's inauguration online DONALD Trump will be inaugurated as the 45th US President later. Here is Express.co.uk's guide to streaming the inauguration online using your mobile, PC and smart TV devices. PUBLISHED: 15:00,   15:18, Fri, Jan 20, 2017 
Viewers around the world will watch Donald Trump take the oath of office during the inauguration ceremony outside the Capitol building in Washington today. 
A million-strong crowd - including 350,000 anti-Trump protesters - is expected to line the streets and gather in front of the Capital dome for the inauguration. Related articles 
Mr Trump will take the oath of office at noon local time (5pm GMT) before giving his inaugural speech as the new US President. 
So, if you want to watch the historic inauguration, here's how to stream all the action online. AFP How to live stream Donald Trump's inauguration today How to watch Donald Trump’s inauguration 
Coverage of the next US President’s inauguration will be shown live on BBC One, BBC News and Sky News in the UK. 
BBC One will begin its live coverage of the inauguration at 4pm GMT with presenter Katty Kay reporting from the Capitol. 
Huw Edwards and Sophie Raworth will present ‘President Trump: The Inauguration’, which will also be shown on the BBC News channel at the same time. 
Sky News will also broadcast a special programme on Mr Trump’s inauguration from 3pm GMT, while Sky Atlantic coverage begins at 4pm. President-Elect Donald Trump in pictures Tue, December 13, 2016 Donald John Trump is an American businessman and politician who is President-elect of the United States as well as chairman and president of The Trump Organization Play slideshow 1 of 64 
The BBC and Sky News will also be showing the match on a desktop computer or laptop via the broadcasters’ own websites. 
You can watch Sky News online here and tune in to the BBC News on the iPlayer website here . 
People in the UK, America and around the world can also live stream Mr Trump’s speech on the Right Side website here . 
Express.co.uk is also providing live coverage of the latest news and drama on its website here. What happens during the inauguration ceremony? 
The inauguration ceremony is due to begin at 11.30am (4.30pm GMT), according to the schedule issued by the Senate. Prelude: ‘The President’s Own’ United States Marine Band Call to Order: The Honorable Roy Blunt - United States Senator, Missouri Readings and Invocation: Archbishop of New York Timothy Michael Cardinal Dolan; Reverend Dr Samuel Rodriguez of the National Hispanic Christian Leadership Conference; and Pastor Paula White-Cain, of the New Destiny Christian Center Musical Selection: Missouri State University Chorale The Vice Presidential Oath of Office: Administered to Michael Richard Pence by Supreme Court Justice Thomas Musical Selection: Mormon Tabernacle Choir The Presidential Oath of Office: Administered to Donald John Trump by the Chief Justice of the United States Inaugural Address: The new President of the United States Readings and Benediction: Rabbi Marvin Hier, of the Simon Wiesenthal Center; Reverend Franklin Graham, of Samaritan's Purse; and Bishop Wayne T. Jackson, of the Great Faith Ministries International: The National Anthem: Jackie Evancho Related articles
